alert.note: Alert for Blackford; Grant; Huntington; Wells (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 11:28PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Grant, Blackford, Huntington and Wells Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1128 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Andrews to near Van Buren to 8 miles west of Anderson. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Bluffton, Hartford City, Gas City, Upland, Ossian, Montpelier, Andrews, Markle, Van Buren, Matthews, Warren, Lancaster, Uniondale, Fowlerton, Shamrock Lakes, Poneto, Mount Etna, Mcnatts and Landess. This includes Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 252 and 290. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
